title: Can you play a guitar at a Guitar Center? - Quora

response.answer_text: Unfortunately you can. This is the chains down fall. I am 64 years old, a child of the late 60’s and early 70’s. I have for the past 30 years had the money to indulge my fantasies and buy what ever equipment I desire. As much as I want, I have never been able to make a major purchase in a Guitar Center Store. Online at Guitar Center, yes. In the store, no. They are full of young punks with no money, showing off riffs at full volume. The staff dotes on them so much that it is impossible to get answers, to try out gear. I get frustrated and go to a local store for my purchase. These kids are in Guitar Center all weekend, they tie up the equipment and staff and probably buy a $ 4 bag of picks. The other problem is the major manufacturers’ control pricing so I can call a local store and get the same pricing as Guitar Center. If Guitar Center was smart they’d use their size to ban the guitar rats and bust the pricing cartel .

Oh sure, no problem……However, I noticed on my last trip to a Guitar Center, that their higher-end guitars are placed waayyy up high, out of reach. BEEE-CAUSE?? They were having sticky fingered misfits carrying their higher end Martins, Gibsons, Taylors, etc., out the front door, stealing them……NOW, you have to ask, to get your hands on a higher end guitar, at Guitar Center, which they will gladly get for you……..As usual, it is the few ‘bad apples’, that makes it harder on us honest folks……..I had a salesman tell me, some miscreant walked out the front door with a brand new,nearly $3,000.00 Martin drednought,and not one of them seen him, and they were watching. MOST CERTAINLY, the thief knew what he was doing, he didn’t light finger a $500 cheapie…….

Yes,I recently was at a Guitar Center in Washington DC, Which is where my crush on Taylor Acoustic Guitars began. But that's another story,not only does Guitar Center have a unbelievable array of Guitars & brands available, There Guitars are separated by brands & hung on the walls & easily accessible in viewing rooms,& each room there are provided stools to set & play,They also provide individual rooms in which you can enter sit down & play & try out the Guitar without the worry of bothering anyone else

I don’t know…CAN YOU???Just joshing. I worked in a music store in the 80s (small pro shop outside NYC not a big box) and peoplewho can actually play are almost always welcome. But unlessyou are testing out the limits of an amp, best not to crank itthrough the roof. Instrumental stuff goes over better as there isnothing missing. BUT do not construe this as it is fine to practiceand woodshed on the show room floor.

You sure can, and the better you play the longer you get to play, and one from the staff will maybe even turn the volume up. But please dont play “Stairway to heaven”, “Eruption”, anything from Nickleback, “Sweet child of mine” or “Smoke on the water”. But if you can play “Little Wing” or actually anything from Jimi Hendrix, people will start to gather around the boot.

Sure. Just ask. However, if you are just there to show your virtuosity instead of to try out an instrument you might want to by, it will become obvious very quickly. Near as I can tell, Guitar Center is in business to sell stuff and make a little money.
I can play guitar at guitar center. Most people can’t. Overplayed Guitar Store Songs (just messing around but please don’t play any of those at any music store)
